text: The prime minister of the Independent State of Samoa () is the head of government of Samoa. The prime minister is a member of the Samoan Legislative Assembly. They are appointed by the O le Ao o le Malo (Head of State) for a five-year term. The incumbent is Fiame Naomi Mata’afa since 24 May 2021. ==List of prime ministers (since 1959)== Portrait Name Elected Term of office Political party O le Ao o le Malo Took office Left office Time in office 1 Fiame Mata'afa Faumuina Mulinu'u II 1961 (1st) 1964 (2nd) 1967 (3rd) 1 October 1959 25 February 1970 Independent Meaʻole Tanumafili II 2 Tupua Tamasese Lealofi IV 1970 (4th) 25 February 1970 20 March 1973 Independent Tanumafili II Fiame Mata'afa Faumuina Mulinu'u II 1973 (5th) 20 March 1973 20 May 1975 † Independent Tanumafili II — Tupua Tamasese Lealofi IV — (5th) 21 May 1975 24 March 1976 Independent Tanumafili II 3 Tui Atua Tupua Tamasese Efi 1976 (6th) 1979 (7th) 1982 (8th) 24 March 1976 13 April 1982 Independent Tanumafili II 4 Vaʻai Kolone — (8th) 13 April 1982 18 September 1982 HRPP Tanumafili II Tui Atua Tupua Tamasese Efi — (8th) 18 September 1982 31 December 1982 Independent Tanumafili II 5 Tofilau Eti Alesana — (8th) 1985 (9th) 31 December 1982 30 December 1985 HRPP Tanumafili II Vaʻai Kolone — (9th) 1988 (10th) 30 December 1985 8 April 1988 HRPP Tanumafili II Tofilau Eti Alesana — (10th) 1991 (11th) 1996 (12th) 8 April 1988 23 November 1998 HRPP Tanumafili II 6 Tuilaepa Aiono Sailele Malielegaoi — (12th) 2001 (13th) 2006 (14th) 2011 (15th) 2016 (16th) 23 November 1998 24 May 2021 HRPP Tanumafili II Tufuga Efi Va'aletoa Sualauvi II 7 Fiame Naomi Mata'afa 2021 (17th) 24 May 2021 Incumbent FAST Va'aletoa Sualauvi II ==References== *
